channel.title: CVE Feed for Apache Software Foundation -- Apache DolphinScheduler
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Apache Software Foundation -- Apache DolphinScheduler

item.title: CVE-2024-30188|2024-08-09T14:23:27.823Z -- apache%20software%20foundation -- apache%20dolphinscheduler
item.description:
File read and write vulnerability in Apache DolphinScheduler ,Â authenticated users can illegally access additional resource files. This issue affects Apache DolphinScheduler: from 3.1.0 before 3.2.2.
Users are recommended to upgrade to version 3.2.2, which fixes the issue.

item.title: CVE-2024-29831|2024-08-09T14:21:48.184Z -- apache%20software%20foundation -- apache%20dolphinscheduler
item.description: Improper Input Validation vulnerability in Apache DolphinScheduler. An authenticated user can cause arbitrary, unsandboxed javascript to be executed on the server. If you are using the switch task plugin, please upgrade to version 3.2.2.

item.title: CVE-2023-49109|2024-08-02T21:46:29.198Z -- apache%20software%20foundation -- apache%20dolphinscheduler
item.description:
Exposure of Remote Code Execution in Apache Dolphinscheduler.
This issue affects Apache DolphinScheduler: before 3.2.1.
We recommend users to upgrade Apache DolphinScheduler to version 3.2.1, which fixes the issue.

item.title: CVE-2023-49250|2024-08-02T21:53:44.724Z -- apache%20software%20foundation -- apache%20dolphinscheduler
item.description:
Because the HttpUtils class did not verify certificates, an attacker that could perform a Man-in-the-Middle (MITM) attack on outgoing https connections could impersonate the server.
This issue affects Apache DolphinScheduler: before 3.2.0.
Users are recommended to upgrade to version 3.2.1, which fixes the issue.

item.title: CVE-2024-23320|2024-07-26T18:29:05.387Z -- apache%20software%20foundation -- apache%20dolphinscheduler
item.description:
Improper Input Validation vulnerability in Apache DolphinScheduler. An authenticated user can cause arbitrary, unsandboxed javascript to be executed on the server.
This issue is a legacy of CVE-2023-49299. We didn't fix it completely in CVE-2023-49299, and we added one more patch to fix it.
This issue affects Apache DolphinScheduler: until 3.2.1.
Users are recommended to upgrade to version 3.2.1, which fixes the issue.

item.title: CVE-2024-23320|2024-02-23T16:57:09.741Z -- apache%20software%20foundation -- apache%20dolphinscheduler
item.description:
Improper Input Validation vulnerability in Apache DolphinScheduler. An authenticated user can cause arbitrary, unsandboxed javascript to be executed on the server.
This issue is a legacy of CVE-2023-49299. We didn't fix it completely in CVE-2023-49299, and we added one more patch to fix it.
This issue affects Apache DolphinScheduler: until 3.2.1.
Users are recommended to upgrade to version 3.2.1, which fixes the issue.

item.title: CVE-2023-50270|2024-02-23T10:17:35.425Z -- apache%20software%20foundation -- apache%20dolphinscheduler
item.description:
Session Fixation Apache DolphinScheduler before version 3.2.0, which session is still valid after the password change.
Users are recommended to upgrade to version 3.2.1, which fixes this issue.

item.title: CVE-2023-51770|2024-06-04T17:20:55.794Z -- apache%20software%20foundation -- apache%20dolphinscheduler
item.description:
Arbitrary File Read Vulnerability in Apache Dolphinscheduler.
This issue affects Apache DolphinScheduler: before 3.2.1.
We recommend users to upgrade Apache DolphinScheduler to version 3.2.1, which fixes the issue.

Users are recommended to upgrade to version 3.2.1, which fixes the issue.
